name: 陳彥璋
objective:
Objectives：
The purposes of this course are to provide an advanced fundamental background in the fluid mechanics of environmental systems and also applying fluid mechanics principles to a variety of environmental issues.  

Specific Elements：
1.　　Role of hydrology and hydraulic engineering in environmental management
2.　　Basics
3.　　Methods of describing fluid motion - the Eulerian picture
4.　　Kinematic transport theorem
5.　　Firkian diffusion
6.　　Turbulent diffusion
7.　　Shear flow dispersion
8.　　Mixing in rivers
9.　　Mixing in reservoirs
10.　　Mixing in estuaries
scorePolicy:
In addition to homework, and the mid-term and final exams, a term paper is also required.  Suggested topics and format requirements are outlined below.
　　Homework　　　　30%
　　Mid-term exam　　20%
　　Final exam　　　　30%
　　Term Paper　　　　20%
materials:
Mixing in Inland and Coastal Waters. H.B. Fischer, J.E. List, J. Imberger, N.H. and Brooks, AP.
Environmental Fluid Mechanics. H. Rubin, and J. Atkinson, Marcel Dekker.
